intro: Ceropegia semota subsp. orientalis, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its fleshy, tuberous roots and thick, succulent stems that store water, allowing it to thrive in arid conditions. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many other ornamental and medicinal plants. Its unique morphology and attractive blooms make it a popular choice for indoor gardening.
